intro: Asplenium macrochlaena, commonly known as the broad-leaf maidenhair fern, is a species of evergreen fern native to Southeast Asia. It features delicate, lance-shaped fronds with a distinctive, bright green color and a serrated edge. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread and form dense clusters. Its leaves are typically 20–40 cm long and have a finely divided, feathery appearance. Asplenium macrochlaena thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
